summary: This document is an email or communication from August 20, 2019, summarizing a lead provided by an individual named Victor. Victor claims to have used computer skills to access Jeffrey Epstein's Delta Airlines account and researched a domain (ellmax.com) linked to Ghislaine Maxwell, offering to share the information with the FBI. The communication is directed to the FBI's Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Victor
persons.context: An individual who contacted the FBI, claiming to have computer knowledge and to have accessed Jeffrey Epstein's Delta Airlines account and researched a domain related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; Victor claims to have reset his Delta.com account password using information from Epstein's black book.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as Epstein's friend; the domain ellmax.com is linked to her alias and Delta accounts according to Victor.

persons.name: David Lampert
persons.context: One of the names listed as a registrar for the domain ellmax.com, as researched by Victor.

connections.description: Victor claims to have conducted unauthorized research and accessed Epstein's Delta Airlines account.
Maxwell is described as Epstein's friend, and a domain (ellmax.com) is linked to her alias.
Lampert is listed as a registrar for the domain ellmax.com, which Victor associates with Maxwell's alias.

events.title: Lead Submission to FBI
events.description: An individual named Victor contacts the FBI's Human Trafficking Task Force, claiming to have accessed Jeffrey Epstein's Delta account and researched a domain linked to Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: An individual named Victor claimed to have reset Jeffrey Epstein's Delta Airlines account password using Epstein's member number from his black book and security questions.
Victor researched the domain 'ellmax.com', finding it was registered to David Lampert and another individual, and linked it to Ghislaine Maxwell's alias and Delta accounts.
Victor offered to share screenshots of the Delta account and 'white pages with Burns addresses' with the FBI.
This communication was directed to the FBI's Human Trafficking Task Force (Squad C20) as an investigative lead.
